articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC return to the scene of the crime when they take on Hearts at Tynecastle on Sunday. It was against the same opponents at the same venue that the champions were introduced to VAR almost a year ago. There was chaos in the capital as the Hoops got a taste of what was to come [...]
articles.title: WELCOME TO VAR: CAPITAL PUNISHMENT FOR CELTIC

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LISBON LION Tommy Gemmell was born on this day in 1943 in Craigneuk, North Lanarkshire to proud parents Alfie and Margaret. He was the player who completely revolutioned the left-back role at Parkhead with his flamboyant raids and pulverising shooting power which terrorised opposing keepers. “My dream was to play for Motherwell,” Gemmell revealed to [...]
articles.title: TOMMY GEMMELL: ‘ONCE A CELT ALWAYS A CELT’

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR and his Scotland team-mates WILL be playing in the Euro 24 Finals in Germany next summer. A goal from Pablo Gavi three minutes after the interval was enough to give Spain a 1-0 win over Norway in Oslo tonight – and open the door to the soccer showpiece for Steve Clarke’s team. The Scots [...]
articles.title: SPANISH AYES: GERMANY HERE WE COME

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: PHILLIPE CLEMENT has been named as Michael Beale’s successor at Ibrox to become the club’s FOURTH manager in two years. The Belgian, who was sacked by Monaco in June, has accepted a three-and-a-half year contract to follow Steven Gerrard, Giovanni van Bronckhorst and the Englishman in quickfire fashion. Clement was handed the challenge following a [...]
articles.title: BELGIAN IS BOSS No.6 TO FACE RODGERS TRIAL

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR and Co will be backing Spain against Norway in the crucial Euro 24 Group A qualifier in Oslo this evening. A win or a draw for the visitors will seal a place for Scotland in next summer’s soccer extravaganza in Germany. The Celtic captain and Hoops team-mate Greg Taylor, who could face World Cup [...]
articles.title: CALMAC AND CO IN PURSUIT OF THE OlÉ GRAIL

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC’S on-fire midfielder Matt O’Riley is hoping to make his debut for Denmark on Tuesday after answering an SOS to join the squad. The 22-year-old Londoner was surprisingly overlooked by manager Kasper Hjulmand for his 23-man pool for the Euro 24 double-header against Kazakhstan and San Marino. The Hoops playmaker has already scored five goals [...]
articles.title: CONFIRMED: O’RILEY EURO CALL-UP

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: EXACTLY a year ago today, James Forrest fired a hat-trick into the Hibs net in a 6-1 romp to become a ton-up Bhoy. The evergreen winger, making his 451st first-team appearance, joined the exclusive Celtic Centurion Club following his devastating display in the art of finishing. Forrest, now 32, became the 30th player in Parkhead [...]
articles.title: THE DAY EVERGREEN CELT BECAME A TON-UP BHOY

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LIAM SCALES is hoping to get the nod to face Gibraltar on Monday, despite seeing his Republic of Ireland debut wrecked by former Celtic team-mate Giorgos Giakoumakis. The Hoops’ revitalised defender, a stand-out in the midst of an injury pile-up at the champions, suffered the anguish of a 2-0 loss in the Euro 24 qualifier at [...]
articles.title: DESPAIR AND HOPE FOR SCALES

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ALISTAIR JOHNSTON came under fire after Canada were routed 4-1 by Japan in an international friendly in Tokyo. Hoops fans’ favourite Johnston was in the wars as he was robbed of the ball [...]
articles.title: CELT JOHNSTON UNDER FIRE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS has counted them in and counted them out. Mark Warburton, Pedro Caixinho and Steven Gerrard plus Graeme Murty in a caretaker capacity [...]
articles.title: ‘RANGERS IN HIS POCKET,’ SUTTON RECKONS RODGERS WILL PILE ON MISERY

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: THE Premiership was a blank canvas back on the morning of August 5 when I stated “trembling thumbs are hovering in the proximity of panic buttons” down Govan way. I mentioned there was anxiety mixed with dread among the Ibrox ranks and adverse results would in all likeilihood provoke a brutal knee-jerk reaction from the [...]
articles.title: ALEX’S ANGLE: PANIC BUTTONS AND DEAD MEN WALKING

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: There are moments when the torch passes from one player to another in football.  Carl Starfelt (28) played for Celta Vigo on Saturday but did not make the bench for Sweden against Moldova last night.  Instead, Gustaf Lagerbielke made his second appearance at the back for Sweden and scored his first goal for his country.  [...]
articles.title: Torch passing moment between Carl and Gus

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: GREG TAYLOR is standing by to add to his 10 international caps when Scotland take on France in a friendly in Lille on Tuesday night. The Celtic defender scored his first goal of the season in the 3-1 win over Kilmarnock at Parkhead at the weekend and will return a week on Sunday to Tynecastle, [...]

articles.description: GUSTAF LAGERBIELKE is looking forward to a double title celebration at the end of the season. And the 23-year-old centre-back, who scored his first international goal for Sweden [...]
articles.title: £3m SWEDE HOPES FOR ‘GOLD PARTY’

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR suffered European misery for the second time in eight days when unlucky Scotland crashed 2-0 to Spain in Seville tonight. Last week, it was a goal from Lazio’s Pedro deep in stoppage-time that inflicted a 2-1 Champions League loss on the Celtic skipper and his team-mates at Parkhead. In Seville, McGregor put in another [...]
articles.title: CALMAC’S EURO WOE CONTINUES

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: The Scotland national team is a decent proxy for Celtic on the international stage.  If anything, they are more limited in resources, unable to innovate in different markets, as we are.  In previous generations, when domestic leagues across the Continent were semi-professional, Scotland’s 5 million population and fully professional league was a sufficient bedrock.  Not [...]
articles.title: A national proxy for Celtic

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: NEW Bhoy Gustaf Lagerbielke has praised “very helpful” Brendan Rodgers. Lagerbielke played the entire 90 minutes-plus in the hectic Glasgow derby at a partisan Ibrox where Kyogo Furuhashi lashed [...]

articles.description: CELTIC legend Billy McNeill made his name as one of the most commanding centre-backs ever produced in this country.
